content: this s cid 415 tch the important thing is to make sure to slip both of the first two s cid 415 tches knitwise together not one at a cid 415 me photo 1 next knit the next s cid 415 tch photo 2 then insert your needle into the 2 s cid 415 tches you slipped in step 1 and pass them over the s cid 415 tch you just knit photo 3 tadaaaa now you have a pre cid 425 y center line that will go all the way up your project photo 4 inst cid 162 cid 167 ctions cast on 17 sts you will have 17 sts including yarnovers in each row of the project row 1 k3 p11 k3 row 2 k4 yo s1k1psso twice k1 k2tog yo twice k4 row 3 k3 p11 k3 row 4 k5 yo s1k1psso yo s2k1psso yo k2tog yo k5 repeat row 1-4 un cid 415 l your work reaches approximately 18 unstretched finishing off cut yarn leaving a 12 tail and sew the ends together using the tail wrong side out then weave in all ends if you like you can lightly block your headband but i don t block mine since wearing it stretches it enough to show the s cid 415 tch defini cid 415 on now you re all ready to put your hair up in a messy bun and wear your new headband on all your autumn adventures cong cid 162 at cid 167 lations you ve now completed your very own arrowwood headband i hope you enjoyed this fun kni cid 427 ng pa cid 425 ern be sure to sign up for our email newsle cid 425 er so you don t miss the next one also i d love to see your work tag me in your photos on instagram using @thechesapeakeneedle #thechesapeakeneedle and #arrowwoodheadband so that i can find you easily i just might share your photos on my page if you had fun using this pa cid 425 ern please consider sharing the link with a friend who might like to make it too you can also find me on pinterest thechesapeakeneedle ravelry lindseyfaciane and instagram @thechesapeakeneedle see you there
